title: Change application domain name references

requirements.text: Add a single configurable "public domain" setting for the frontend (e.g., an env var or a central config constant) and use it anywhere the app needs to reference its own domain/host so the domain can be changed without hunting through code.

quotes: i want to change the domain name

acceptanceCriteria: There is exactly one clearly-documented place to set the app’s public domain (e.g., `VITE_PUBLIC_DOMAIN` or similar).
No UI text is introduced that hardcodes the previous domain.
Changing the configured domain updates all self-domain references that were wired to the setting.

requirements.text: Replace hardcoded references to the current domain where applicable, including the external logo URL host and any other occurrences of `growithtutor.com` in the React marketing header/footer and the standalone static landing page, so they can be updated to the new domain via the new domain setting (or via a clearly documented constant in the standalone page).

quotes: i want to change the domain name

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/components/marketing/MarketingHeader.tsx` and `frontend/src/components/marketing/MarketingFooter.tsx` no longer hardcode `https://growithtutor.com/...` directly in-line; the hostname is sourced from a centralized configuration.

`frontend/static/growwithtutor-standalone/index.html` no longer hardcodes `https://growithtutor.com/...` directly in-line; the hostname is sourced from a clearly documented constant for the standalone page.
After changing the configured domain/host, the marketing header/footer logo loads from the updated domain (assuming the asset path exists on that domain).

requirements.text: Update deployment documentation to include explicit instructions for changing the production domain (DNS + any Internet Computer hosting/canister URL considerations) and explicitly list all project locations that are affected by a domain change (including the standalone landing page).

quotes: i want to change the domain name

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md` contains a section titled similar to "Changing the Domain" that documents the steps and the config value(s) to update.
The doc lists the React app domain setting and the standalone landing page domain setting (if separate) and explains how to keep them in sync.

requirements.text: Add a small “Domain Settings” checklist item or note somewhere appropriate in the app’s existing setup/checklist UX so an admin/deployer can easily verify the currently configured domain in the UI.

quotes: i want to change the domain name

acceptanceCriteria: A setup/checklist area of the app displays the currently configured public domain/host value.
The displayed value is read-only (no need for an in-app editor) and matches the configuration setting used by the app.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.

Do not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, or `frontend/src/main.tsx` (compose instead of editing immutable paths).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo` (no new backend canisters/services).
nonGoals: Implementing a registrar purchase/transfer flow for the domain.
Adding third-party DNS/provider integrations or automated certificate provisioning.
Changing the site/brand name (e.g., `SITE_NAME`) unless explicitly required for the domain change.
